questions.text: Have the external and internal issues that are relevant to the organization's purpose and strategic direction been determined?
Have the interested parties that are relevant to the quality management system been determined?
Has the scope of the quality management system been defined?
Has top management demonstrated leadership and commitment to the quality management system?
Have the quality policy and quality objectives been established?
Has top management ensured the integration of the quality management system requirements into the organization's business processes?
Has the organization determined the risks and opportunities that need to be addressed to ensure the quality management system can achieve its intended outcomes?
Has the organization determined the actions needed to address the risks and opportunities identified?
Has the organization integrated the actions into its quality management system processes?
Has the organization identified the internal and external issues that are relevant to its information security management system?
Has the organization determined the interested parties that are relevant to its information security management system?
Has the organization determined the scope of its information security management system?
Has top management demonstrated leadership and commitment to the information security management system?
Has the information security policy been established, implemented, and maintained?
Has top management ensured that the responsibilities and authorities for roles relevant to information security are assigned and communicated?
Has the organization determined the risks and opportunities that need to be addressed to ensure the information security management system can achieve its intended outcomes?
Has the organization established, implemented, and maintained processes to address the risks and opportunities identified?
Has the organization integrated the actions into its information security management system processes?
